alert.note: Alert for Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:45PM CDT until July 05 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR JONES AND SOUTHEASTERN LINN COUNTIES... At 945 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Scotch Grove, or 8 miles east of Anamosa, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Anamosa, Mount Vernon, Monticello, Lisbon, Springville, Olin, Wyoming, Martelle, Onslow, Prairieburg, Morley, Center Junction, Whittier, Langworthy, Stone City, Viola, Matsell Bridge Natural Area, Howard H Cherry Scout Reservation, Wapsipinicon State Park and Hale. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
